creator: TEAN sarl
descriptionHtml:
FOR WHOM ?
For young people who want to read the analogue clock quickly and safely, even without numbers; For adults who want to support children in learning to tell the time; For those who want to learn how to tell time in other languages.


CAN YOU READ THE CLOCK WITHOUT NUMBERS?

As a teen or young adult in the digital age, can you still tell the time from an analog dial? Do terms like “quarter to four” still mean something to you?
Is reading the time from the position of the two hands a challenge for you too? Or do you just want to learn how to say the time in French or other languages?
Then you are at the right place!
The TEAN learning app for the analog clock offers you 10 different dials so that you can train at your own pace and then read the clock quickly and safely in any situation. The text display can be selected between 7 languages.

DO YOU WANT TO TEACH A CHILD THE ANALOG CLOCK?

Are you looking for an interactive learning aid that shows the 24 hours on a clock face?
Would you like to be able to clearly convey terms such as “fifteen minutes” and “half an hour”?
Are you convinced that the analog clock with hands and dial promotes the understanding of the concept of time and fragmentation in a playful way?
Then you are at the right place!

These considerations prompted us to develop the TEAN app. For children who are learning, but also for teenagers and young adults who want to learn reading time again. In fact, we observe that young people, starting at the age of 13-15, when they get mobile phones, tablets and computers, stop reading the time on the analog clock. Everything is digital and they simply loose the intuitive ability to read the time based on the position of two hands. However, understanding an analog clock face is an important foundation for learning other abstract skills.


The TEAN analog clock learning app offers a range of 11 selectable sequential clock faces for learning three skills:

Reading the exact time on a 24-hour clock face.
Shift the reading of time from the numbers to the hands by using a sequence of animated dials.
The pronunciation of time in 7 languages
​​3. The meaning of the buttons

"Select Level"

There are four learning levels.
Level “Beginner” to familiarize yourself with the watch. The hour is read using the red number and the red hand, the minute using the blue number and the blue hand. In addition, the time can be read in 24 hours.

Level “Intermediate” progressively replaces hour numbers with symbols which are still highlighted in red for the current hour.

Level “Advanced” progressively replaces minute numerals with symbols. These are also highlighted.

The “Expert” levels no longer feature color highlighting and further reduce the markings, so that in the end only a very abstract watch face is displayed.

With “Roman” we offer a clock dial with Roman numerals, just like those found on the church towers.

TOUCH to show time expression
When this button is pressed, the time indicated by the hands appears as text in the same field. This is especially useful for learning terms like “a quarter to four” or “half past six”. This text can be presented in 7 different languages.

LANGUAGE
Here you can select one of the 7 preset languages ​​for the text display and then display it with the button “Touch to show time expression”.

TRAINING
Pressing this button moves the hands to a random time position. Here you can practise your skills.

NOW
This button takes you back to the current time.
descriptionShort: Can you read the clock? Here you learn it! And in 7 languages ​​too!

descriptionShort: Can you read the clock? Here you learn it! In 7 languages ​!

appDetails.recentChangesHtml:
major update:
- larger clock face with improved number readability
- new languages: Swedish, Norwegian, Finnish, Hungarian
- selected language now indicated by the country flag
- shaded minutes in training mode for more intuitive recognition of past/to the hour

title: TEAN - Learn the Clock!

creator: TEAN sarl
descriptionHtml:
FRENCH VERSION IS FOR FREE !

FOR WHOM ?
For young people who want to read the analog clock quickly and safely, even without numbers; For adults who want to support children in learning to tell the time; For those who want to learn how to tell time in other languages.


CAN YOU READ THE CLOCK WITHOUT NUMBERS?

As a teen or young adult in the digital age, can you still tell the time from an analog dial? Do terms like “quarter to four” still mean something to you?
Is reading the time from the position of the two hands a challenge for you too? Or do you just want to learn how to say the time in French or other languages?
Then you are at the right place!
The TEAN learning app for the analog clock offers you 11 different dials so that you can train at your own pace and then read the clock quickly and safely in any situation. The text display can be selected between 11 languages.

DO YOU WANT TO TEACH A CHILD THE ANALOG CLOCK?

Are you looking for an interactive learning aid that shows the 24 hours on a clock face?
Would you like to be able to clearly convey terms such as “fifteen minutes” and “half an hour”?
Are you convinced that the analog clock with hands and dial promotes the understanding of the concept of time and fragmentation in a playful way?
Then you are at the right place!

These considerations prompted us to develop the TEAN app. For children who are learning, but also for teenagers and young adults who want to learn reading time again. In fact, we observe that young people, starting at the age of 13-15, when they get mobile phones, tablets and computers, stop reading the time on the analog clock. Everything is digital and they simply loose the intuitive ability to read the time based on the position of two hands. However, understanding an analog clock face is an important foundation for learning other abstract skills.

The TEAN analog clock learning app offers a range of 11 selectable sequential clock faces for learning three skills:

- Reading the exact time on a 24-hour clock face.
- Learn reading time from the position of the hands instead from numbers. Our sequence of animated clock dials will guide you.
- The pronunciation of time in 11 languages
​​
The meaning of the buttons:

TRAINING
Pressing this button moves the hands to a random time position. Here you can practice your skills.

NOW
This button takes you from training mode back to the current time.

AM/PM
This button shows a small AM or PM sign in the center of the dial, depending upon the daytime.

LEVEL
Here you can set the difficulty of the learning level from "Beginner" to "Expert". 3 Levels are for free, the others can be accessed upon purchase.
With the additional level “Roman” we offer a clock dial with Roman numerals, just like those found on the church towers.

LANGUAGE
Select one of the 11 preset languages ​​for the text display and then display it with the button “Touch to show time expression”. French language and digital clock are for free, the others can be accessed upon purchase.

PURCHASE
Pushing this button leads you to purchase the access to the full feature app and enjoy using all languages and all clock dials for your learning experience.

TOUCH TO SHOW TIME EXPRESSION
By touching this button, the time indicated by the hands of the clock dial is shown here as text expression. This is especially useful for learning terms like “a quarter to four” or “half past six”. Digital clock and French language are for free, the others can be accessed upon purchase.
descriptionShort: Can you read the clock? Here you learn it! In 11 languages ​!

appDetails.recentChangesHtml:
- Change behaviour of the training function
- Allow to change time in training mode by touching the clock
- Visual improvement

TOUCH TO SHOW TIME EXPRESSION
By touching this button, the time indicated by the hands of the clock dial is shown here as text expression. This is especially useful for learning terms like “a quarter to four” or “half past six”. Digital clock and French language are for free, the others can be accessed upon purchase.

TRY OUT THE FULL VERSION WITH ALL LANGUAGES DURING ONE WEEK FOR FREE !

FOR WHOM ?
For young people who want to read the analog clock quickly and safely, even without numbers; For adults who want to support children in learning to tell the time; For those who want to learn how to tell time in other languages.

These considerations prompted us to develop the TEAN app. For children who are learning, but also for teenagers and young adults who want to learn reading time again. Everything is digital and they simply loose the intuitive ability to read the time based on the position of two hands. LANGUAGE

As new subscriber, when pushing this button, you can try out the full version for one week for free before entering into our promotional subscription for one year for the cost of an ice-cream. You can cancel your subscription any time during the free trial period without being billed.

title: TEAN - Learn the Clock!

creator: TEAN sarl
descriptionHtml:
Now NEW with QUIZ and LEARN mode !

FOR WHOM ?
For young people who want to read the analog clock quickly and safely, even without numbers; For adults who want to support children in learning to tell the time; For those who want to learn how to tell time in other languages.

CAN YOU READ THE CLOCK WITHOUT NUMBERS?
As a teen or young adult in the digital age, can you still tell the time from an analog dial? Do terms like “quarter to four” still mean something to you?
Is reading the time from the position of the two hands a challenge for you too? Or do you just want to learn how to say the time in French or other languages?
Then you are at the right place!

The TEAN learning app for the analog clock offers you 5 different levels so that you can train at your own pace and then read the clock quickly and safely in any situation. The text display can be selected between 13 languages.

DO YOU WANT TO TEACH A CHILD THE ANALOG CLOCK?
Are you looking for an interactive learning aid with an approach to step up the levels?
Would you like to be able to clearly convey terms such as “fifteen minutes” and “half an hour”?
Are you convinced that the analog clock with hands and dial promotes the understanding of the concept of time and fragmentation in a playful way?
Then you are at the right place!

These considerations prompted us to develop the TEAN app. For children who are learning, but also for teenagers and young adults who want to learn reading time again. In fact, we observe that young people, starting at the age of 13-15, when they get mobile phones, tablets and computers, stop reading the time on the analog clock. Everything is digital and they simply loose the intuitive ability to read the time based on the position of two hands. However, understanding an analog clock face is an important foundation for learning other abstract skills.

The TEAN analog clock learning app offers a range of 5 freely selectable clock faces of different abstraction for learning three skills:
- Learn reading time from the position of the hands of the analog clock instead from numbers of the digital clock
- Learn which digital time corresponds to a displayed analog time
- Learn the time expressions in 13 languages how people really tell time

In our approach you can do this learning on 5 different freely selectable levels. Level 1 shows only the full hours, level 2 also half hours and level 3 also quarter hours. For the other levels 4, 5 and Roman time is shown in 5-minutes intervals.

Additionally the clockfaces start with very concrete and highlighted numbers for hour and minute in Level one and then become increasingly more abstract ending on level 5 with a very sparsely marked clock. And as bonus you also have the Roman clock as you can find it on many churches and clock towers.

With our LEARN mode you can observe on your selected level the randomly set times on the clock and guess and verify the corresponding digital time or how to tell this time in words.All languages are freely available.

…and to make all this real fun we have included a QUIZ mode where you can test how good you are. Within a selectable time frame of 1,2 or 3 minutes you have to tap the correct answer for 10 randomly displayed times on the clock for the level you have chosen.
descriptionShort: Can you read the clock? Here you learn it! In 13 languages ​!
title: TEAN - Learn the Clock!

creator: TEAN sarl
descriptionHtml:
Now NEW with QUIZ and LEARN mode !

FOR WHOM ?
For young people who want to read the analog clock quickly and safely, even without numbers; For adults who want to support children in learning to tell the time; For those who want to learn how to tell time in other languages.

CAN YOU READ THE CLOCK WITHOUT NUMBERS?
As a teen or young adult in the digital age, can you still tell the time from an analog dial? Do terms like “quarter to four” still mean something to you?
Is reading the time from the position of the two hands a challenge for you too? Or do you just want to learn how to say the time in French or other languages?
Then you are at the right place!

The TEAN learning app for the analog clock offers you 5 different levels so that you can train at your own pace and then read the clock quickly and safely in any situation. The text display can be selected between 13 languages.

DO YOU WANT TO TEACH A CHILD THE ANALOG CLOCK?
Are you looking for an interactive learning aid with an approach to step up the levels?
Would you like to be able to clearly convey terms such as “fifteen minutes” and “half an hour”?
Are you convinced that the analog clock with hands and dial promotes the understanding of the concept of time and fragmentation in a playful way?
Then you are at the right place!

These considerations prompted us to develop the TEAN app. For children who are learning, but also for teenagers and young adults who want to learn reading time again. In fact, we observe that young people, starting at the age of 13-15, when they get mobile phones, tablets and computers, stop reading the time on the analog clock. Everything is digital and they simply loose the intuitive ability to read the time based on the position of two hands. However, understanding an analog clock face is an important foundation for learning other abstract skills.

The TEAN analog clock learning app offers a range of 5 freely selectable clock faces of different abstraction for learning three skills:
- Learn reading time from the position of the hands of the analog clock instead from numbers of the digital clock
- Learn which digital time corresponds to a displayed analog time
- Learn the time expressions in 13 languages how people really tell time

In our approach you can do this learning on 5 different freely selectable levels. Level 1 shows only the full hours, level 2 also half hours and level 3 also quarter hours. For the other levels 4, 5 and Roman time is shown in 5-minutes intervals.

Additionally the clockfaces start with very concrete and highlighted numbers for hour and minute in Level one and then become increasingly more abstract ending on level 5 with a very sparsely marked clock. And as bonus you also have the Roman clock as you can find it on many churches and clock towers.

With our LEARN mode you can observe on your selected level the randomly set times on the clock and guess and verify the corresponding digital time or how to tell this time in words.All languages are freely available.

…and to make all this real fun we have included a QUIZ mode where you can test how good you are. Within a selectable time frame of 1,2 or 3 minutes you have to tap the correct answer for 10 randomly displayed times on the clock for the level you have chosen.
descriptionShort: Can you read the clock? Here you learn it! In 13 languages ​!
title: TEAN - Learn the Clock!

creator: TEAN sarl
descriptionHtml:
June-23: New version with major improvements
Start with the hours, then half hours, then quarter ...

FOR WHOM ?
For kids who want to learn reading/ telling time with the analog clock quickly and safely, for school and for life. For adults who want to support children in learning to read/tell the time; For those who want to learn how to tell time in other languages.

HOW DOES IT WORK?
The TEAN analog clock learning app offers four distinct learning modes:
1) Read Clock Quiz
In this quiz you see random time on an analog clock and you need to tap on the one digital clock out of 4, which shows the same time. Here you learn to read the time shown by the analog clock. The clock face, the hour mode and the response speed are selectable.

2) Tell Time Quiz
In this quiz you see random time on an analog clock and you need to tap on the one analog time expression out of 3, which shows the same time. Here you learn how to correctly "tell time" in words. The clock face, the hour mode and the response speed are selectable.

3) 24h Quiz
In this quiz you see random time on a novel 24 hour analog clock and you need to tap on the one digital clock out of 4 which shows the same time. Here you learn how the morning hours 0-11 (AM) and the afternoon hours 12-23 (PM) are shown on the analog clock. The hour mode and the response speed are selectable.

In all 3 quiz modes you answer 10 questions and you can observe your results in green or red on the result bar on the top of the screen. Once the quiz completed, depending on your settings and results, you see which step we recommend you to do next.

4) Free Exercise
This mode has no time constraint. You can simply set the analog clock to random times by tapping on it or on the button below and then try to read it and tell the time shown. Then you can verify if your "telling" is correct. A special assistance helps you to decide if the shown time is "past" or "to" the hour. The clock face and the hour mode are selectable and the assistance can be turned on or off.
descriptionShort: Can you read the clock? Here you learn it! In many languages ​! From scratch.

appDetails.recentChangesHtml:
- major release
- learning menu
- hour level selectable
- 5 speed levels
- dedicated 24h learning mode

title: TEAN - Learn the Clock!

creator: TEAN sarl
descriptionHtml:
Learn reading the clock and telling time according to the requirements of the Swiss education system:
Start with the hours, then half hours, then quarter hours and finally the 5-minute graduation.

FOR WHOM ?
For kids who want to learn reading/ telling time with the analog clock quickly and safely, for school and for life. For adults who want to support children in learning to read/tell the time; For those who want to learn how to tell time in other languages.

HOW DOES IT WORK?

In this quiz you see random time on an analog clock and you need to tap on the one digital clock out of 4, which shows the same time. Here you learn to read the time shown by the analog clock. The clock face, the hour mode and the response speed are selectable.

2) Tell Time Quiz
In this quiz you see random time on an analog clock and you need to tap on the one analog time expression out of 3, which shows the same time. Here you learn how to correctly "tell time" in words. The clock face, the hour mode and the response speed are selectable.

3) 24h Quiz
In this quiz you see random time on a novel 24 hour analog clock and you need to tap on the one digital clock out of 4 which shows the same time. Here you learn how the morning hours 0-11 (AM) and the afternoon hours 12-23 (PM) are shown on the analog clock. The hour mode and the response speed are selectable.

In all 3 quiz modes you answer 10 questions and you can observe your results in green or red on the result bar on the top of the screen. Once the quiz completed, depending on your settings and results, you see which step we recommend you to do next.

4) Free Exercise
This mode has no time constraint. You can simply set the analog clock to random times by tapping on it or on the button below and then try to read it and tell the time shown. Then you can verify if your "telling" is correct. A special assistance helps you to decide if the shown time is "past" or "to" the hour. The clock face and the hour mode are selectable and the assistance can be turned on or off.
descriptionShort: Learn with our interactive app on different quiz levels - until you master it !

descriptionShort: Learn with our interactive app on different quiz levels - until you master it !
title: TEAN - Learn the Clock!

creator: TEAN sarl
descriptionHtml:
To hear all languages as voice-over, please install the google text-to-speech engine as follows:
1) On your mobile go to "Settings" (the small cogwheel at the top)
2) scroll down to "General Management" and tap on it
3) Tap on "Text-to-speech"
4) Tap on "Preferred engine"
5) Select "Speech Recognition and Synthesis from Google"
That's it - now you can listen to all the languages !

Learn reading the clock and telling time according to the requirements of the Swiss education system:
Start with the hours, then half hours, then quarter hours and finally the 5-minute graduation.

Go to "Exercise" mode and read AND LISTEN how to really tell time in your language. You prefer first to test how good you are with one of the quiz? Go ahead!

FOR WHOM ?
For kids who want to learn reading/ telling time with the analog clock quickly and safely, for school and for life. For adults who want to support children in learning to read/tell the time; For those who want to learn how to tell time in other languages.

HOW DOES IT WORK?
The TEAN analog clock learning app offers four distinct learning modes:
1) Read Clock Quiz
In this quiz you see random time on an analog clock and you need to tap on the one digital clock out of 4, which shows the same time. Here you learn to read the time shown by the analog clock. The clock face, the hour mode and the response speed are selectable.

2) Tell Time Quiz
In this quiz you see random time on an analog clock and you need to tap on the one analog time expression out of 3, which shows the same time. Here you learn how to correctly "tell time" in words. The clock face, the hour mode and the response speed are selectable.

3) 24h Quiz
In this quiz you see random time on a novel 24 hour analog clock and you need to tap on the one digital clock out of 4 which shows the same time. Here you learn how the morning hours 0-11 (AM) and the afternoon hours 12-23 (PM) are shown on the analog clock. The hour mode and the response speed are selectable.

In all 3 quiz modes you answer 10 questions and you can observe your results in green or red on the result bar on the top of the screen. Once the quiz completed, depending on your settings and results, you see which step we recommend you to do next.

4) Free Exercise
This mode has no time constraint. You can simply set the analog clock to random times by tapping on it or on the button below and then try to read it and tell the time shown. Then you can verify if your "telling" is correct. A special assistance helps you to decide if the shown time is "past" or "to" the hour. The clock face and the hour mode are selectable and the assistance can be turned on or off.
descriptionShort: With sound! Listen to the voiceover in exercise mode in different languages!
